com.chap.links.client
Class Timeline

java.lang.Object
  
      com.chap.links.client.Timeline

public class Timeline
extends

The timeline is a visualization chart to visualize events in time. The timeline is developed in javascript as a Google Visualization Chart. This Timeline class is a GWT wrapper for the javascript code.

Nested Class Summary
 class Timeline.DateRange
          DateRange contains a start date and an end date
static class Timeline.Options
          Options for drawing the timeline.

Timeline

Timeline

public Timeline(AbstractDataTable data,
                Timeline.Options options)
Constructor

Parameters:
data - A google visualisation datatable containing the events. The table has three columns: start (type DATETIME), end (type DATETIME), content (type STRING)
options - A name/value map containing settings for the timeline. See the class Timeline.Options for all available options

options - A name/value map containing settings for the timeline. See the class Timeline.Options for all available options

addSelectHandler

public final void addSelectHandler(com.google.gwt.visualization.client.events.SelectHandler handler)
Add a select handler. When the user clicks on an event on the timeline, the corresponding row in the data table is selected. The visualization then fires the select event.

Parameters:
handler - A select handler

addRangeChangeHandler

public final void addRangeChangeHandler(com.google.gwt.visualization.client.events.RangeChangeHandler handler)
Add a changerange handler. The changerange event is fired repeatedly when the the visible range is being changed by user interaction (moving or zooming), but not after a call to the setVisibleChartRange method. The new range can be retrieved by calling getVisibleChartRange method.

Parameters:
handler - A select handler

addRangeChangedHandler

public final void addRangeChangedHandler(RangeChangedHandler handler)
Add a changeranged handler. The changeranged event is fired once after the visible range has been changed by user interaction (moving or zooming), but not after a call to the setVisibleChartRange method. The new range can be retrieved by calling getVisibleChartRange method.

Parameters:
handler - A select handler

addAddHandler

public final void addAddHandler(AddHandler handler)
Add an add handler. An event is about to be added. Fired after the user has clicked the button "Add event" and created a new event by clicking or moving an event into the Timeline. The Add event can only occur when the Timeline is made editable (width option.setEditable(true)). The AddHandler is defined inside the class Timeline.

Parameters:
handler - An add handler

addChangeHandler

public final void addChangeHandler(ChangeHandler handler)
Add a change handler. The change event is fired after the position of an event is changed by dragging it in the Timeline. The Change event can only occur when the Timeline is made editable (width option.setEditable(true)). The ChangeHandler is defined inside the class Timeline.

Parameters:
handler - A change handler

addDeleteHandler

public final void addDeleteHandler(DeleteHandler handler)
Add an delete handler. An event is about to be deleted. Fired after the user has clicked the button "Delete event". The Delete event can only occur when the Timeline is made editable (width option.setEditable(true)). The DeleteHandler is defined inside the class Timeline.

Parameters:
handler - A delete handler

addEditHandler

public final void addEditHandler(EditHandler handler)
Add an edit handler. An edit event is fired when the user double clicks an event. The Timeline just fires the event, and a corresponding action should be implemented by The EditHandler is defined inside the class Timeline.

Parameters:
handler - An edit handler

addTimeChangeHandler

public final void addTimeChangeHandler(TimeChangeHandler handler)
Add a timechange handler. The timechange event is fired repeatedly when the position of the custom-time bar is changed by dragging it in the Timeline. The timechange event can only occur when the option showCustomTime is true The TimeChangeHandler is defined inside the class Timeline.

Parameters:
handler - A change handler

addTimeChangedHandler

public final void addTimeChangedHandler(TimeChangedHandler handler)
Add a timechanged handler. The timechanged event is fired once when the position of the custom-time bar has been changed by dragging it in the Timeline. The timechanged event can only occur when the option showCustomTime is true The TimeChangedHandler is defined inside the class Timeline.

Parameters:
handler - A change handler

addReadyHandler

public final void addReadyHandler(com.google.gwt.visualization.client.events.ReadyHandler handler)
Add a ready handler. The ready event is fired when the Timeline is ready for external method calls.

Parameters:
handler - A ready handler

cancelChange

public void cancelChange()
Cancel a change event. This method can be called inside an event listener which catches the "change" event. The changed dates of the event will be undone.

cancelAdd

public void cancelAdd()
Cancel adding an event. This method can be called inside an event listener which catches the "add" event.

cancelDelete

public void cancelDelete()
Cancel deleting an event. This method can be called inside an event listener which catches the "delete" event.

getSelections

public final  getSelections()
Returns a selection array containing the selected row

Returns:
Selection array

setSelections

public final void setSelections( sel)
Set a new selection

Parameters:
sel - A Selection array containing one selection. The timeline accepts only one selection element, which must have the property row.

setVisibleChartRange

public void setVisibleChartRange(java.util.Date start,
                                 java.util.Date end)
Set a new start and end date Use the function redraw() to redraw after changing the time

Parameters:
start - A Date object containing the start date.
end - A Date object containing the end date.

setCurrentTime

public void setCurrentTime(java.util.Date time)
Set the current time in the timeline. This can for example be changed to match the time of a server or a time offset of another time zone.

Parameters:
time -

setCustomTime

public void setCustomTime(java.util.Date time)
Adjust the custom time in the timeline. Only applicable when the option showCustomTime is true.

Parameters:
time -

getCustomTime

public java.util.Date getCustomTime()
Retrieve the custom time. Only applicable when the option showCustomTime is true. time is a Date object.

Returns:
time

setVisibleChartRangeNow

public void setVisibleChartRangeNow()
Move the visible range such that the current time is located in the center of the timeline. This method does not trigger a rangechange event.

Parameters:
start - A Date object containing the start date.
end - A Date object containing the end date.

setVisibleChartRangeAuto

public void setVisibleChartRangeAuto()
Move the visible range such that all loaded events are within the visible range. This method does not trigger a rangechange event.

Parameters:
start - A Date object containing the start date.
end - A Date object containing the end date.

getVisibleChartRange

public Timeline.DateRange getVisibleChartRange()
returns the current value of the start Date

Returns:
{Date} start A Date object

setAutoScale

public void setAutoScale(boolean enable)
Enable or disable autoscaling. If enable true or not defined, autoscaling is enabled. If false, autoscaling is disabled.

Parameters:
enable -

setScale

public void setScale(Timeline.Options.SCALE scale,
                     double step)
Set a custom scale. Automatic scaling will be disabled. For example scale=SCALE.MINUTES and step=5 will result in minor steps of 5 minutes, and major steps of an hour. Available scales: MILLISECOND, SECOND, MINUTE, HOUR, DAY, MONTH, YEAR. As step size, choose for example 1, 2, 5, or 10.

Parameters:
scale -
step -

createJso

protected JavaScriptObject createJso(Element parent)

draw

public void draw(JavaScriptObject data,
                 Timeline.Options options)
Draws the visualization.

Parameters:
data - The DataTable with the items
options - The options for drawing this visualization.

onLoad

protected void onLoad()

onResize

public void onResize()

unselectItem

public void unselectItem()
Unselect the currently selected event (if any)

zoom

public void zoom(double zoomFactor,
                 java.util.Date zoomAroundDate)
Zoom the timeline the given zoomfactor in or out. Start and end date will be adjusted, and the timeline will be redrawn. You can optionally give a date around which to zoom. For example, try zoomfactor = 0.1 or -0.1

Parameters:
zoomFactor - Zooming amount. Positive value will zoom in, negative value will zoom out
zoomAroundDate - Date around which will be zoomed. Optional

zoom

public void zoom(double zoomFactor)
Zoom the timeline the given zoomfactor in or out. Start and end date will be adjusted, and the timeline will be redrawn. For example, try zoomfactor = 0.1 or -0.1

Parameters:
zoomFactor - Zooming amount. Positive value will zoom in, negative value will zoom out

move

public void move(double moveFactor)
Move the timeline the given movefactor to the left or right. Start and end date will be adjusted, and the timeline will be redrawn. For example, try moveFactor = 0.1 or -0.1

Parameters:
moveFactor - Moving amount. Positive value will move right, negative value will move left
